intro: Bouvardia humboldtii var. corymbiflora, commonly known as the clustered bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces blooms in shades of pink, white, and red, which appear in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental plants. Its delicate appearance and long-lasting blooms make it a valuable addition to both indoor and outdoor gardens.
